TEXT.citation: Early, R. J., & Whitehorn, J. (2003). One hundred Paiwan texts. Pacific Linguistics, Research School of Pacific and Asian Studies, The Australian National University.
TEXT.BibTeX_citation: @book{100paiwantexts, author = {Robert Early and John Whitehorn}, title = {One Hundred Paiwan Texts}, year = {2003}, publisher = {Pacific Linguistics, Research School of Pacific and Asian Studies, The Australian National University}}

S.FORM: izua aza sitsuayan ti sa Ḍiququ a se Kapayuanan.
izoa aza sicoayan ti sa Driqoqo a se Kapayoanan.
S.TRANSL: Once upon a time there was a man of Kapayuanan called Ḍiququ.

S.FORM: muri livuin na se Qalu.
mori livoin na se Qalo.
S.TRANSL: East Paiwans were going to invade the area.

S.FORM: kidaringungu, sa daringunguin a djelapał izua i Dinukapan.
kidaringongo, sa daringongoin a djelapalj izoa i Dinokapan.
S.TRANSL: He got some (gum?) tree wood, and put it on the rock slab at Dinukapan.

S.FORM: mangtjez a se Qalu.
mangtjez a se Qalo.
nu kidjulat tazua dinaringungu, sekulasu sa patsay.
no kidjolat tazoa dinaringongo, sekolaso sa pacay.
S.TRANSL: When they stepped on the place with the slippery wood, they fell off and died.

S.FORM: matsidił anga a tjeza ta matsay.
macidilj anga a tjeza ta macay.
S.TRANSL: Only one survived (‘excluded from the dead’).

S.FORM: "sau vaiku," aya ti sa Ḍiququ tazua se Qalu.
"sao vaiko," aya ti sa Driqoqo tazoa se Qalo.
S.TRANSL: “Be off with you,” said Ḍiququ to this East Paiwan.

S.FORM: "łakua nu mangtjez sun izua i qinałan, tisun a matsay."
"ljakoa no mangtjez son izoa i qinaljan, tison a macay."
S.TRANSL: “But when you get back to your village, you will die.”

S.FORM: izua ti sa Ḍiququ anga kidjulat a pizua i Dinukapan; azua taił a kula i Padain.
izoa ti sa Driqoqo anga kidjolat a pizoa i Dinokapan; azoa tailj a kola i Padain.
S.TRANSL: Ḍiququ himself (was so big that) when he had one foot at Dinukapan, his other foot was at Padain (across the valley, and he had a very long penis (OA)).

S.FORM: izua za ti Muakai a se Padain tjemenutjenun.
izoa za ti Moakai a se Padain tjemenotjenon.
tevuta aza kulits i tju djełep.
tevota aza kolic i tjo djeljep.
S.TRANSL: A penis appeared along the wall.

S.FORM: "aki anema tsu?" aya mikeduts.
"aki anema co?" aya mikedoc.
vełatjen ta vaida.
veljatjen ta vaida.
S.TRANSL: She hit it with her weaver’s sword,

S.FORM: mangeḍuq aza kulits ni Ḍiququ.
mangedroq aza kolic ni Driqoqo.
S.TRANSL: and Ḍiququ’s penis was cut off.

S.FORM: viłviłen nimadju aza kulits; namadjui anga namałavangas anga tua kinalaḍuq.
viljviljen nimadjo aza kolic; namadjoi anga namaljavangas anga toa kinaladroq.
S.TRANSL: He dragged it along, and it got thorns and burrs on it because it was so long.

S.FORM: semudjui semułavangas ti Ḍiququ, tjanu ita i tjakaz.
semodjoi semoljavangas ti Driqoqo, tjano ita i tjakaz.
S.TRANSL: When he pulled all the thorns and burrs out, they filled a winnowing basket.
